newsitem.title: FRANCE: Cargo hit by Air France Europe Orly strike.
newsitem.headline: Cargo hit by Air France Europe Orly strike.

text.p: A strike by Air France Europe (ex-Air Inter) ground staff at Paris-Orly airport has brought the airline's freight traffic at its Paris hub to a standstill,a company official told Reuters.

"Despite our shuttle flights operating between Orly and Nice, Marseille and Toulouse we have had to put an embargo on freight in and out of Orly because ramp handling services cannot be assured," he added.

Apart from the shuttle services, all of Air France Europe's flights to and from Orly have been suspended until at least 1300 local time (1200 gmt) pending the outcome of negotiations between staff and management currently taking place, the official added.
Staff are seeking talks on unifying their pay and employment terms with those of parent company Air France in a merger betweeen the two airlines which takes effect today, April 1.

A strike by ground staff working for the Paris airport authority, the Aeroports de Paris (ADP) at Charles de Gaulle (CDG) and Orly airports has resulted in delays in the departures of a number of passenger services operated by foreign airlines, an ADP official said.

Delays of 30 to 45 minutes have occurred on some flights, notably at CDG Terminal 1. This is due to a strike by ADP staff providing check-in services for several airlines. Negotiations are continuing to try and solve the dispute."
No stoppages at Charles de Gaulle were reported by baggage and freight handling staff, the official added.
